examples.mission: I want to learn logistic regression and machine learning techniques in Python for my data science career

enhanced_metadata.title: Logistic Regression - Clearly Explained!!!
enhanced_metadata.meta_description: An in-depth explanation of logistic regression with step-by-step examples and Python implementation
enhanced_metadata.extracted_text: Logistic regression is a statistical method used for binary classification problems. In this tutorial, we'll explore the mathematical foundations, implement it in Python, and discuss real-world applications in data science and machine learning.
enhanced_metadata.youtube_description: Logistic regression is one of the most fundamental algorithms in machine learning and statistics. In this comprehensive tutorial, we'll cover: 1) The mathematical foundation of logistic regression 2) How it differs from linear regression 3) Step-by-step Python implementation using scikit-learn 4) Real-world examples and applications 5) Common pitfalls and how to avoid them. Perfect for beginners and intermediate data scientists looking to master this essential technique.
enhanced_metadata.og_description: Master logistic regression with this comprehensive tutorial covering theory, implementation, and real-world applications

enhanced_metadata.title: 9. Classes â€” Python 3.12.0 documentation
enhanced_metadata.meta_description: Python classes tutorial covering class definition, inheritance, and object-oriented programming concepts
enhanced_metadata.extracted_text: Classes provide a means of bundling data and functionality together. Creating a new class creates a new type of object, allowing new instances of that type to be made. Each class instance can have attributes attached to it for maintaining its state. Class instances can also have methods for modifying their state.
enhanced_metadata.og_description: Learn object-oriented programming in Python with classes, inheritance, and methods

Academic resources: arxiv.org, scholar.google.com, university websites

metadata_generation_rules.educational_indicators: Count keywords like: tutorial, learn, course, education, explain, guide, how-to, lesson, training, academic, research, algorithm, programming, development, science, mathematics
metadata_generation_rules.entertainment_indicators: Count keywords like: funny, comedy, meme, cute, viral, trending, celebrity, gossip, music video, gaming, reaction, prank, challenge, fail, epic
metadata_generation_rules.youtube_descriptions: Educational videos: 200-500 chars with learning objectives. Entertainment: 100-200 chars with engaging language
